turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yes. Now come on, all or nothing.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Not now. I have an idea.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Listen, it's important. We need to talk about what we're going to do --

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: After you drink to love and happiness forever.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Good luck. I love that guy, but why does he have to follow us around?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Anyway, what I was wanting to say was this --

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yeah, but you were good, you were really good. Fucking bin-bag', I liked that. You were good. You explored your maleness to the full there.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Downstairs, I know. Pensioner's terror ordeal: page six.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: No, it doesn't. I tried to let it worry me but it won't. I've worked on that paper for three years. There is a pensioner's terror ordeal on page six every day. Every day. Maybe when I'm a pensioner it'll worry me.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: What's all this for, more security?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I fitted a lock up there. On the inside.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No, I'm sure, that'll be enough.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Not eating like you used to, that's what.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: If you give me the plate, I'll eat.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Secure it? What do you mean -- you're gong to take it to a bank? You're not going to take it to a bank? You're not going to take it to a bank Or what, you want to bury it? Is that it?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What for? What did you want? The money? Was that it?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: We just wanted to speak to you.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It wasn't deep enough. I told you it wasn't deep enough, but you wouldn't listen.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: It doesn't neccessarily matter. They don't even know who those people are, and even if they did, they have nothing to connect them with us, nothing at all.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm glad you're so certain, Alex. It makes us feel a whole lot better.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: They can know all they like, it won't do them the slightest bit of good --

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: They know? So what? They have nothing, there is nothing, to connect us to that bodies stuff.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Sex lines? Is that it? Triple X-rated interactive fantasy? Old habits die hard.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yeah, I was phoning your mother.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You old devil. Well, anyway, as you can see, we're leaving.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yeah, I'm sorry, but that's the way it is.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: It's all right. I'll forward your mail.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No, really, I am sorry, sorry to be ducking out on you like this. I hope you won't take it personally.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Oh, no, no, no. Don't let it worry you. Not at all. It's probably for the best.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: For the best. Exactly. I wouldn't want things to end on a downer.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I mean, we've had ups and downs, right -- good times, bad times?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: But more laughter than tears, I think? Yes. On balance? I mean, remember that time when -- oh, we could talk all night, but we have to go. Don't we, Juliet?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No, can't think of anything else that matters.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's very kind of you to offer, but --

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Where do you think you'll go?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Where will we go? Where will we go? Juliet?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I bought the tickets. One for her and one for me. It was my idea.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Your idea? Well, that fits. I mean, the two of you, that fits together. I should have seen that long ago.

turns.speaker: EDITOR
turns.text: Out in the woods. Three bodies. Decomposed. Mutilated. Beyond recognition.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I don't know anything about it.

turns.speaker: EDITOR
turns.text: Of course you don't know anything about it. If you knew anything about it, I wouldn't have to send you over there to cover it.

turns.speaker: EDITOR
turns.text: Animals involved? I know, but you need a change. And besides, we're short.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Well, I've got this story, it's really good, I'm working on, that is good, I feel it could be big, it this, eh, and it's, you know, it's incredible. Am I right, did you say beyond recognition'?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: This is just an informal discussion.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: It looks like he's writing everything down.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: That's because he is. Does that upset you?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I've never seen any of these men before.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Take another look at these two.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: And if I told you their car was parked outside, would that surprise you?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: No, not any more. I just wondered if it would surprise you.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: What? Uh, no, no, it's a fake. I picked it up in Thailand. The second hand doesn't sweep, you see.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Tell you what. If you do remember seeing any of these guys, maybe you could give me a phone, on this number, any time you like.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Good. Well, you've seen the flat?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yes. It is, isn't it? We alllike it. And the room's nice too, don't you think?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Spacious, quiet, bright, well appointed, all that sort of stuff, all that crap.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: So tell me, Cameron, what on earth -- just tell me, because I want to know -- what on earth could make you think that we would want to share a flat like this with someone like you?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Nothing. We thought you were someone else.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: When you slaughter a goat and wrench its heart out with your bare hands, do you then summon hellfire?

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: I mean, what are you actually doing here? What is the hidden agenda?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: When you get up in the morning, how do you decide what shade of black to wear?

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Now, let me get this straight. This affair that you're not having, is it not with a man or not with a woman?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: And when did anyone last say to you these exact words: You are the sunshine of my life'?

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: OK, so A has left you, B is ambivalent, you're still seeing C but D is the one you yearn for. What are we to make of this? If I were you, I'd ditch the lot. There's a lot more letters in the alphabet of love.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yeah, he had one too many of thise urges. You of all people should know that.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: God, you two are sensitive. All I'm doing is implying some sort of sordid, ugly, sexual liason. Why, I'd be proud of that sort of thing.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Maybe you should go, Alex.You'll meet someone wonderful.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: For my life? At a discussion group? I think not.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: No. Be someone else like him. One is enough. And what happened to that girl, that friend of yours, the one that came round. I liked her. I really felt we had something. She could have moved in. We had chemistry.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: -- more than anyone she has ever met. In her whole life.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: -- I'd be the first topoint that out. In all kindness I would. But, like they say, you know, she's got to want to change, hasn't she?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Has he tried down the back of the fridge? I mean, that's where I normally find things.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: He seemed like a nice guy, Alex.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I don't know. He sounded Swedish. Do you know any Swedish men? Maybe it was just the emotion.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: What? Oh, yeah, sure, if you want. I tell you, every letter this guy writes to you is the same: they all begin like pure love and descend into open pornography. I dream of your thighs, the soft touch of your white skin leading me in desire, while I, aroused and inflamed --'

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: He even signs them, in his own name, can you believe it? I'd sign someone else's name. I'd sign his name. If I wrote them, that is. Which I don't.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: In a moment he's going to tell he could have been someone --

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: It was you, Juliet, it was you --

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: The man we know and love.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: A miserable, burnt-out, empty shell of a -- Alex pauses, looks at his drink, then at Juliet.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: You see, they don't really know me.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: No, Alex, we don't really love you.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: No. Any idea which channel he's on?

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Alex, how shouldI know? I'm just a girl.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I will ask you once more, what sort of car --

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: A blue one, OK. And it's still there.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Hugo. Hugo. Sorry about this, but can you open the door? It's us, Hugo, your flatmates and companions. Your new-found friends. He's not in. He's left and we'll probably never see him again.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Alex, the key is in the keyhole on the other side.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: You want me to kick it open?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I wonder how he did it?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I wonder how he killed himself. I presume that that's what happened. What do you think?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Why not? What's wrong, Juliet? Aren't you curious? Don't you wonder what he died from?

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: No.The guy's dead.What more do you need?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: It's not every day I find a story in my own flat.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Thats not a story, Alex. It's a corpse.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Old newspaper proverb says dead human being is living story. Be rational, please, and failing that be quiet.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: But you're a doctor. You kill people every day.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: I don't want to. It's different.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Whoever draws the short straw does it all. That way, you either do it or you don't. All or nothing.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yeah, we don't want another stiff on our hands. Don't fall through the ceiling. OK? Is he listening to me?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I don't know why we couldn't stuff it in a mattress or put it under the floor like any normal human being. We could have hid it in the fridge.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I want my money back. Excuse me.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: David, I promise we will. Keep him happy.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: It's not for me. It's for love and happiness forever.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yes, it is. It's him. Cameron, Cameron, come on over.Yo!

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Well, you certainly had a good look around.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Don't know. No one said anything. ALEX Rendered speechless with desire. I recall that feeling, from the days when I had such a thing.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Yeah, you're making us all nervous.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Is this the same stuff you made last week?

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: I hope it tastes better than the other stuff.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: I don't want it to taste different. I don't know why I bother. Is that enough for you? Hey!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: You know, you should spend some of that money instead of worrying about it. That's my advice.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: He's right. You'd feel much better about it.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Once it's spent you won't have to worry about it.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Be like a weight off your shoulders.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: I don't see the point in that.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Because that's no good. Remember, we did what we did, we took the money. It was a material calculation. But what's the use if it's underground, or in some funny bank in some funny place? If you can't spend it, if you can't have it, what use is it? None. It's nothing, all for nothing, if you do that. I didn't get into this for nothing, so that I could have nothing --

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: He'll come down. Leave him alone.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yeah, he's got to go to work, hasn't he? You think he'll come down for that?

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: No, but he's looking after the money, so what's the problem?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Looking after it -- he's probably fucking well eating it.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Boy, am I glad to see you.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: He won't do anything for me, but for you --

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: He isn't safe up there. If you really cared about him, you'd use your influence to get him down, then he'd be safe.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Now you thought of that, not me.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Aren't you going to answer it?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Well, I'm not expecting anyone either.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: No, definitely not. And that's that. I refuse to discuss it further.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: No, I'm not frightened. A little terrified maybe. Did you see what happened to the last two who tried that? They went up alive and they came down dead -- the difference, I mean, alive dead dead alive, that sort of thing. It wasn't difficult to spot. He killed them both: he cut them up.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: And if it sounds like I'm being killed, you'll phone the police, you'll tell them everything?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Everything. Except maybe that it was his idea and not mine in the first place. OK? That's important to me. I need to die misunderstood.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: As smart as you are, you'll need a little help.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Yes, of course. Why wouldn't I be?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I don't know. I thought maybe I was --

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: We were just sorting things out.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Of course, but I think you'll find the print medium provides a more lucid and detailed --

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: It makes us feel a whole lot better.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: That's what I thought he said.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: The perfect couple, I should say.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: You mustn't take it so badly.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Don't worry about it. I'd do exactly the same, but I don't think I'm his type.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Stop him, Alex. You've got to stop him.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Let him go. Let him take it all.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yeah, well, that's what she said. Interesting. That's why you're here, you see.

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: You were going to say something.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: What was I trying to say? Oh, yes, I think, we think, or at least I suppose we think -- am I right?

turns.speaker: HUGO
turns.text: You mean I can have the room?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Well, that's what I said, isn't it?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Good evening. I'm Detective Inspector McCall and this is DC Mitchell. I wonder if we could ask you some questions.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: So I just heard her cries for help and all that, and when I went downstairs there were already those other people there, so I just stood around really, waiting -- you know how people do -- and then when your colleagues arrived I came back upstairs. And that's about all, I think. I didn't actually see anything useful, I don't think.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: did you hear anything before he cries?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No, not that I recall, I was asleep.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Have you seen anything or anyone suspicious around here in the last few days?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Well, if you do, you'll let us know?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: And the other three people on the flat, did they hear anything?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: There are only two other people in the flat.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: We understood there were four people living here. Not always, of course, but now, four.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No, three. Who said there were four?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: How strange. And how unsatisfactory to have misleading information. Only three people here. You're sure?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Take a note of that, Mitchell. Only three, rather than four. Write it down. You can use numbers or words, I have no preference. Which are you using?

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: I doubt it. And these two other people, did they hear anything?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No, they were asleep. They didn't even wake up.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Yes. Why do you think you woke and they didn't?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't know. Maybe I'm a light sleeper.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Loks like you had a break-in up here as well.

turns.speaker: MCCALL
turns.text: Is this where no one stays?

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Why do you want a room here?

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Look, it's a fairly straightforward question. You're either divorced or you're not.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: OK, I'm going to play you just a few seconds of this tape -- I'd like you to name the song, the lead singer and the three hit singles subsequently recorded by him with another band.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: It's just that you strike me as a man trapped in a crisis of emotional direction, afflicted by a realization that the partner of your dreams is, quite simply, just that.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Did you ever kill a man?

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Just get on with it, Alex.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Keep it going, Alex. You're unstoppable now.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Is this what they always look like?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I've never seen a dead body before.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Alex, I think it's time for you to stop.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh, yes, I'm fine, thanks, just fine.

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Would you like to talk about it?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Do you know many of these people?

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: Do you think you could be a little more forceful next time?

turns.speaker: JULIET
turns.text: It's alright. I think he got the message anyway.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: That was stressful. I found that stressful.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You paid two hundred pounds for this?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No, no, no. That's what you paid for it. Two hundred pounds is what you paid for it. We don't know what it cost us yet, for you two to have a good time, we don't know the cost of that yet.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Visitors? Some friends maybe? Someone you talked to?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I thought you'd gone to work.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We already know. All about it.
